values:
Where have I been? 

I'll tell you.  

I have been on Facebook, Xanga, and MySpace.  

Am I a traitor? 

Perhaps.  

Do I keep in contact with more people on those other sites? 

Most definitely.  



Anyway, I'm just popping in to say hello.  

Hello.

Whoa. 
It's been ages since I've updated. 

I'm really sorry that I've been such a slacker. 
But most of you probably didn't miss me at all. 

I'm in Hagerstown for the summer, which is very quickly coming to a close. (the summer, I mean.) 

So, if any of you want to hang out, you must let me know very soon.  
I miss all of you a lot! 

I will try to be more faithful.  

But my loyalty lies elsewhere...

:)

I have a xanga now.  

www.xanga.com/SnoWhite11120

So, if any of you have that, feel free to look me up.  

I'm sorry if this betrayal hurts any of you...

I will still try to update on this as much as I can.  

:) 

Love and miss you guys!

Sorry, it's been a long time since I've updated. 
In case anyone is wondering, my recital went REALLY well!! 
I seriously have never felt anything like the feeling that I got when I finished singing a song and heard the applause that came from all the people that came to hear me...
Oh, it was amazing.  
And now that it's finished, I'm relieved, but also missing it...
And I only have about two weeks left until I graduate!! 
So, that's basically what's going on with me now...trying to finish strong! 
(I hope senioritis doesn't get the better of me)

Oh wow. 
So, my recital is a mere 5 days away (probably less by the time anyone reads this)...
but here's the deal. 
I'm not really stressed.
I think it will be fine!
*sigh*
It's a really good feeling to know that I have learned enough that I am capable of putting on a performance and not worrying about it like crazy. 
Anyway, that's a relief. 
Not to say that I'm not anxious or wanting it to be over.
Because I am haha
But I'm also excited! 
:)
And my family will be here on Saturday! 
(By family, what I really mean is my dad, my grandfather, and my sister)
Anyway, I'll let you know how it goes.
P.S. I love getting dressed up!!!

The Opera Scenes went really well, and I just got back from spring break on Sunday night :) 
I went to Detroit with some friends, and we had a really good time "in the hood." 
HAHA
Just kidding. 
But seriously...

Oh, and now, my senior recital is in like two weeks!! 
I'm excited but also a little bit stressed. 
It's a lot to put together. 
But I'm really glad for the opportunity. 
I already bought my dress and I know everything I'm singing :) 
I'm doing four French songs, three Italian (including a song from "La Boheme"), three German, a duet with my friend Rebekah, and then I'm doing songs from the movie "Sense and Sensibility" (they are SO pretty). 
I'm ending with "My White Knight" from "The Music Man" (for all those North High folks, you know why I'm doing that) and then my last song will be...
"Think of Me" from "The Phantom of the Opera." 
I'm REALLY excited! 
If anyone feels like taking a road trip to Missouri on April 3...
lol 
Which also happens to be my birthday! 
Anyway, that's what's going on with me...
I'll keep you posted.

Friday is the first night of Opera Scenes! 
I'm very excited :) 
Oh, and I hope that I don't suck. 
HAHA

4:30 am--Wake up to write a paper on Gibbons' "The Silver Swan" that is due at 9:00. 

6:15 am--Go outside (in the DARK) to get my music score out of the Fine Arts building.

8:48 am--Finish printing out paper (the printer is retarded!)

8:59 am--Walk to class and find a note on the door...

"9:00 Choral Materials class is cancelled today; I had a dentist's appointment.  Papers will be due next Wednesday."

Well, as almost all of you are aware...Valentine's Day is tomorrow.  
And while some people will refer to it as Single Awareness Day or whatever other clever name they can come up with for an alternative holiday not revolving around romance, I think there is one important thing to remember: 
Whether or not you have a valentine, crush, date, or "significant other" isn't really the point.  
Because Valentine's Day is not just about romantic love.  
It's about remembering those people that you care about and letting them know how you feel.  
Think about your family, friends, and anyone that you come into contact with from day to day. 
Let them know that you love and care about them.  
Also, don't forget the one Perfect Love: remember to thank God for His love...and let Him know that you love Him too!! 
:)

Yesterday was my scholarship audition.  
This is where we go in front of all the music professors to show our talent in the hopes that they will give us the most amount of money for the following semester.  
And my teacher told me I had to do this song that is basically lethal.  It is SO hard, but I have to do it for Opera Scenes so she told me this would be my "practice." 
Thanks, Jane.  I'll just practice away my chance at getting money, because I CAN'T sing this song!! 
Well, I sang it.  
It was the first time I had ever gotten through it without practically dying.  It was very exciting.  
And my teacher was right! It was good to do that in front of the professors because now I don't feel as nervous singing it again! :) 
Moral of the story: sometimes the teachers ACTUALLY know what they are talking about!!!

There are some times in my life when I feel like I am definitely capable to doing something great.  
Those times when people are so encouraging and I feel really good about myself and it seems like nothing can keep me from fulfilling my dreams.  
Then there are times like these...

I never seem to catch up.  
It's like a never-ending "to do" list...I add on as many things as I cross out until I just give up for a while.  Then things start piling up and I never get things accomplished.  
It's very frustrating.  
For example, this week, I have so many things going on that I didn't do anything last night.  Yeah, that's right.  I have SO MUCH to do that I didn't know where to start.  So I didn't do anything. 
I went to sleep. 
I need to get on top of things.  
But I have no motivation. 
Does anybody out there have a cure for intense senioritis?

I'm not exactly sure, but I think the night librarian just tried to see if I would be his valentine. 
A little wierded out. 
That is all.

Here I am! 
Yeah, it's me again.  
I'm actually writing more than one entry within a month's time! haha
Tonight, after my extremely busy day (as all Tuesdays and Thursdays are), I went down to Scott Hall basement (that's the guys dorm) to watch "Die Fledermaus" (which is indeed an OPERA) on DVD with some of my friends.  Almost everyone that watched it is going to be in it for our opera scenes this year.  It's a really funny opera.  I'm playing Rosalinda, the wife of a man (Eisenstein) who is being sent to prison for 8 days because he called a policeman a "donkey."  But before he goes to jail, he decides to have a night of fun and go to a party hosted by a prince.  However, I know about it and go as well, disguised as a Hungarian countess (haha).  And I flirt with my own husband and succeed in catching him cheating on me...with...ME! It's really funny, if you followed that at all.  
But the point is, we all watched it and had fun singing our parts along with the video and laughing our heads off at some of the hilarious things we are going to have to do.  
Good times.  
So, we're doing that on 24-25 February, and I'm excited :) 
That's the main thing that I have to look forward to...most everything else going on is actually stressing me out lol 
Oh, well, I'm sure you all understand.  
I hope things are going well...I'll try to write again soon (sorry if my life is boring).

So, here I am, trying to be a better LiveJournal-er.  
It's really hard for some reason now.  
Maybe it's because I don't have anything to say.  
But that can't be true, because I love to talk.  
I think it's because I can't seem to find the time.  
But I WILL try harder.  
I really miss all of you, and I hope you're all doing well. 
I'm sorry if I'm a rotten friend who doesn't keep in touch with anyone.  
I've always been really bad at that: calling people, writing letters, getting together over breaks.  
So, please forgive my laziness.  I really do think about you guys ALL the time :) 
I have a wonderful miracle to report...
I was having some voice problems at the beginning of the semester where my voice would hurt really bad everytime I talked basically.  
So singing was out of the question.  
But now, I'm getting better, and it makes me REALLY happy!! 
Yay for Jesus! 
Um...I'm sure I have more stories, but if I am successful in the "more often" plan, I will tell you more next time.  
:)

So, apparently, I haven't updated in like 10 weeks or something.  
My bad.  
I will try to do better.  
Anyway, what's new with me? 
Well, not much really.  Classes, singing, school stuff...same old same old.  
OH! 
OK, so, finally, at the age of 21 years and 9 months, I got my learner's permit. 
Isn't that pathetic?
I didn't really want to get it, but I sort of had to, so that I can drive for my student teaching semester next fall.  
So that's new.  
This semester, my classes are: Choral Materials, Post-Romantic/20th century Music History, Percussion Techniques, Secondary Curriculum and Instruction, Tests and Measurements, and the usual choirs, voice lessons, and opera scenes.  
Should be interesting.  
My senior recital is also this semester.  It is going to be on my birthday, April 3.  
I'm excited, but also nervous.  
In February, we are once again doing opera scenes, and I will be playing Rosalinda in an act from "Die Fledermaus." 
My song is really hard, but it should be fun! :) 
I think that's about it for now...
I'll try to update more often. 
I hope you all are doing well...I miss you!!

I have SO much homework to do, but I have no time to do it.
And I'm really tired too. 
*yawn* 
See? 
That's 10 pm on a Saturday night. 
PATHETIC! 
I want to do something Saturday night-ish...but I know that if I do, not only will I have procrastinated yet again on my work, but I'll also be exhausted.  
Just a list of all the things I have to do by the end of the week (this is mostly for my own benefit): 
~Do a writing assignment on a chapter of reading for Choral Conducting 
~Recite a song in German with correct pronunciation 
~Conduct a Russian choral piece while being able to sing or play any part while conducting and also pronouncing the Russian correctly 
~Be able to sing some French and German songs for my voice lessons
~Write a reflection on a speaker from a previous class 
~Write a choral arrangement of "Blessed Assurance" with piano accompaniment (and conduct it for the class to perform) 
~Do the book questions for 3 chapters of reading for Secondary Music Methods 
~Learn piano accompaniment of 3 songs for a girl's voice lesson
~Research and create a powerpoint presentation on discoveries in brain development and their implications for the classroom 
~Take a listening test as well as a written test on Beethoven and Schubert 
~Draw an illustration for a customer 
~Rehearse and perform in a chorale concert
This is excluding class and practicum attendance, practice time, work hours, and any other assignments I may be unaware of...all this by Friday.  
I think I wrote that out just so that I could get my thoughts in order.  Sorry for the bore.  
But at least now I'm putting it out there so that you guys will have something to tell the morgue when they are trying to figure out the cause of death.  
HAHA 
No, it's cool.  
I actually have fun being involved in so many things.  I just sometimes wish there were more hours in a day.  
But since there aren't, I should probably stop wasting my time writing on LiveJournal and get to work! 
See ya!

Well, I know I promised an update...but I really don't know how many people actually read my journal, so I'm not going to go into it unless people really do want to know.  
In which case, I would be glad to give you lots of fun stories.  
Because tour was really fun and a good experience, just not as crazy as last year. 
Anyway, this past weekend I went to Peoria, Illinois for regional NATS.  
For those of you unaware, NATS is a singing competition and some of the voice students from my school went and competed.
I was actually still really tired vocally from the tour and also the change in weather had made my throat really dry.  I was so afraid I was going to suck.  
But once again, prayers were at work and I was somehow able to sing pretty well. 
I advance to the semi-final round, and actually some of my friends (Brent and Nathan) got into the top 3 in their divisions.  
It was a fun trip and we all got to know our voice professors a lot better (crazy kids).  
Other than that, the only updates I have are as follows: 
~I am so exhausted that I skipped two classes today just to get a normal amount of sleep.  
~I haven't exercised in about 3 weeks and I really REALLY need to.  
~I have tons of homework that I have yet to begin...and probably won't begin...
~I'm not going to eat anything again until November (HAHA!) 
~Happy Halloween!
~The fourth season of "Gilmore Girls" is airing on ABCFamily tomorrow and that makes me happy.  
~I'm pretty sure I'm going to have my senior recital on my birthday (which is April 3)...but don't quote me yet.  
Um...I think that's it for the updates.  
I'm pretty sure nobody reads these anyway, so if you do, you're awesome and I'll hopefully be back soon! :)

Here I am on Concert Choir tour. 
Again. 
I love touring and singing and all that fun stuff. 
I haven't written in so long because things have been pretty crazy at school.  
Which is why I'm so thankful for this week and the opportunity to just relax and not think about school.  
I mean, tour is pretty much exhausting and a LOT of hard work...but it's a different kind of work and one that I enjoy supremely more than homework.  
And I just found out that when I get back from tour tomorrow, I will have a temporary roommate from CBC!! 
Because apparently one of there dorms caught on fire and 300 students need a place to stay.  
Which is great and I'm glad to help out, but my room is like a WRECK.  And plus, I'm not there.  I'm here on tour.  
It's just kinda wierding me out that as I'm sitting here, there is some random girl sleeping in my messy dorm room.  
I don't know...it's kinda crazy. 
Anyway, when I get back I will give a full report on this year's fall tour.  
I know you're all dying with anticipation. 
:)

Healthy eating habits plus college student equals...
What? 
I'm stumped.  
Because as far as I'm concerned, the two rarely, if ever, coincide.  
I feel like I just ate the world lol 
It's so gross.  
Why do I eat salsa and chips and chocolate cake at a restaraunt at MIDNIGHT?! 
Sick. 
Actually, I've been doing pretty well with getting to be more healthy and active and stuff like that.  
But every once in a while (like tonight for example) I do something really stupid.  
But it's ok...
I'll exercise tomorrow. :) 
Isn't this life style so glamorous? 
All I have to say is, thank goodness for forgiveness...because that chocolate cake was sinful!
Homework is stupid.  It should die.

Well, I'm glad that I believe in Jesus.  
Because he is completely awesome.  
Seriously.  
Here I am, totally inadequate and it shouldn't even matter if I can or can't sing at a stupid Master Class, right? 
I mean there are so many other things going on in the world that God is probably concerned over...so why would he care about the quality of my voice? 
BECAUSE HE LOVES ME. 
That's why. 
He actually cares about all the little details in my life that seem so trivial.  
Let me tell you, today when I was getting ready to sing...I had no idea what sort of sound would come out of my mouth.  I had not been able to sing and it hurt when I talked all day.  
And even when I was singing, I was thinking, "Man, I can do so much better than this...this is crap!" 
But because of all the people that prayed for me and had faith in God, it all went so well.  
The lady that was critiquing came up and the first thing she said was, "How old are you?" 
I said, "21..." thinking "Why the heck is she asking me this?!" 
And she just paused then said, "Well.  Someday, probably soon, you are going to play this part and you are going to do an amazing job, because this song sounds great in your voice."  
WHAT??!?
I was so shocked.  I'm sure I blushed like 5 shades of red.  
But I was so relieved.  
They liked it, and they thought I sounded good, and I was able to share with dozens of people how much of a miracle it was that I was able to sing.  
And now I'm sharing it again with all of you.  
GOD IS AWESOME!!! 
He cares about me, and he also cares about you.  
If you ask him, he will come and help you.  Maybe not in the way you expected him to...but he will be there.  
He loves you and so do I. 
Thanks to all of you who prayed; I hope you are all having a great week so far :) 
I LOVE JESUS!

I have to sing a deathly difficult Mozart aria at a Master Class tomorrow. 
And guess what? 
My throat hurts and I can barely talk.  
Why does this always happen to me?! 
It's so frustrating. 
What am I supposed to do? The programs have already been written, and I have to sing! 
Any of you who believe in God (and even some who don't lol)pleeeease pray for me if you read this before Monday, because I need a miracle. 
Thanks.
I love you all and I hope you are all doing well!

Well.
I guess updating every few days is harder than I thought.  
It seems wierd that I just started doing this LiveJournal thing last year at around this time.  
Things are pretty good around here.  
I'm having a few issues but I'm working through them. 
I'm trying really hard to keep up with my classes (so far it hasn't been the most successful undertaking, but we'll see how it goes this week). 
I'm really excited about Concert Choir! There are some awesome new people in it and we're going to have a great time!
I'm debating whether or not to be in my church choir again...I need to make that decision really soon.  
Like yesterday.  
But I've got all of this other stuff on my mind at the same time, and it can get a tad overwhelming.  
But it's good...somehow I'm surviving! 
And I'm excited because I know it's my senior year and the last chance I'll have to do all of this stuff.  
My room is really pretty by now...I knew I would get it all done eventually! 
Other than that I don't know that I have anything super interesting to report. 
I hope everyone is doing well...
I miss you all like crazy!

Just kidding about the one book thing...
I had to buy like 5 altogether.  
But for 17.5 credit hours and 10 courses, you have to admit that 5 books to buy isn't bad at all. 
The only book I really struggled with having to buy was this one book for a class called Content Area Reading.  It's a class that teaches us how to help kids "read to learn, not just learn to read." 
That's cool; I love to read.  And I fully support this whole idea. 
HOWEVER
I am a MUSIC education major.  
All you really read in music classes is...music. 
So I'm seeing the class as totally irrelevant, and the fact that it was my most expensive book made it kind of hard to justify.  
Oh well.  I'm not complaining. I mean it could have been a lot worse. 
The classes will all be fun though. 
I'm looking forward to the semester. 
Room update: progress is being made.  My bedroom/sink portion of the room is completely clear and organized, and my posters are all being flattened as I write.  
They will be ready to adorn the walls by tomorrow, so the room will finally look normal!

Well, so far I only have to buy one book (Jesus loves me!) 
But I'm sure that tomorrow will be a different story...
So far the classes have been good.  I'm sure they're all going to be fun and beneficial, but I am also sure that I will be extremely busy!  
It's been so awesome seeing my friends here!  I never realize how important they are to me until I come back here and see them.  
And then once I do, I start to miss all of my Maryland friends, and it's interesting...
I think I like living this "double life."  
And it's especially intriguing when these worlds collide...like when my family comes to Missouri to visit, or when my friends come to Hagerstown to stay with me...or when the Concert Choir sings at my church...
It's fun. I wish we could all be together.  
Oh and for those of you who were wondering...
NO.  
My room is NOT finished yet...
:( 

I'll get right on that.

My room's still not finished. 
This slacking is not a good sign...
Classes start day after tomorrow and I need to be READY! 
Hopefully it will work :)

Why am I always such a procrastinator? 
And lazy! 
This whole day went by and my room is still a disaster. 
I keep thinking, "Oh I don't have to be finished until Thursday..." 
But we did have an awesome thunderstorm today! 
Major flooding and the electricity went off three times.  
It was non-stop thunder!! 
And the flooding was quite interesting. 
Some friends and I were going to dinner when we saw a log floating down the road! 
It was hilarious :) 
And the double rainbow was really bright! 
I love weather like that! 
Anyway, I hope I get a lot more finished tomorrow than I did today...
Although, I did get my "Phantom" collection set up.  
So I'm happy for now 
:-D

Finally!! 
Thank you thank you thank you, Jesus! 
I have my own computer. 
My own computer that actually works. 
My own computer that, thanks to Evangel University, is now giving my high-speed internet access.  
Ahhhhh....
This is amazing. 
I'm here, in my dorm room, and I'm updating my LJ. 

Sorry, I'm still adjusting to this freedom.  
So for those of you just dying to hear about all the happenings in my life, be comforted and know that I will now have virtually unlimited opportunities to write.  
That is, until I start getting tons of homework.  
But until then, I can't wait to start reading and see what is happening in all of your lives!! :) 

It's good to be back!

Yes!! 
An opportunity to use the internet!
This is probably only about the third time this has happened all summer long.  
Being without access certainly makes you appreciate it more when you finally get on. 
Anyway, just wanted to let you guys know that I'm doing just fine here, up in Maine with some of my family...
Swimming and kayaking in the lake...
Swinging on the tree swing beside the lake...
Eating picnics, fishing, and having lots of fun at the lake...
Yeah. 
Don't worry about me. 
I'm doing just fine, thanks. 
:) 
Happy Independence Day!

I'm sorry I haven't written in so long.  
The thing is, now that I'm back at home, I have no internet access at our house.  
Heck, I don't even have computer access for that matter.  
So any comments or e-mails that I get probably won't be read for a while.  
The only reason I'm on now is because I'm at Melody's house and she has graciously allowed me to visit the world of LJ and e-mail for a little while. 
So, as most of you know I'm here in Hagerstown, keeping really busy.  
If any of you want to hang out while I'm here just let me know (preferably not through the computer) lol 
I'm working at Marshall's and spending a lot of time drawing and going to Bethel.  
It's great to be back, and I'm really enjoying my summer, being with friends and family.  
Well, I don't really have much else to say since most of the people that read this are in the area.  
I hope I get to see all of you in the near future, and it's sad not to have a computer at home...
:)

Well, I'm back in Maryland! 
The trip was long (as usual) and the packing thing was pretty hectic.  
But I'm so happy to be home!! 
There is still a lot of stress though because I still haven't unpacked and the room my sister and I share is SO small that I have no idea how I'm going to fit all of my stuff in it lol 
Oh well...
I'm sure we'll figure out something.  
I think I'm just going to take a few days and try to get all of that stuff situated, then I need to figure out what to do for work.  I have some decisions to make but I'm sure that will also work out.  
I'm just really looking forward to relaxing, making some money, and spending quality time with friends and family.  
That includes you!! 
So if any of you want to hang out, let me know!!! 
:)

I'm really sorry that it has taken me so long to update everyone.  
I've been extremely busy with everything, from the opera to finals and moving out and stuff.  
The opera was amazing!  
I can't believe that I got to be a part of it! So many people came to it, and everyone loved it :) 
A lot of people had never seen an opera before, and they were pleasantly surprised to find that it was not boring...but it was actually interesting and funny.  
And I love being involved in stuff like this: putting on stage make-up, wearing beautiful costumes, and becoming someone else as I sing in the spotlight.  
*Sigh*
Yeah, it was great.  
But I'm also glad it is over, because it has taken up so much time and energy that I can now use to study, pack, or watch TV and lay around (which I have been doing frequently)
Just an update on the "Phantom of the Opera," I have now seen it 13 times...11 in the movie theater, once on Broadway, and once in my room (today...it's on DVD!) :) 
I have been diagnosed as obsessed by my friends, and I'm sure that it is true.  But I don't mind. 
Only a few days until I get home!  I'm really excited about the summer but also really unsure as to what I will be doing.  Oh well, I guess I'll figure it out soon enough.  
I miss everyone, and I can't wait to see those of you in the general Hagerstown area :)

We had our dress rehearsal last night, and it went really well!  
It was PACKED! 
Seriously, someone said there was not an empty seat in the whole theater! 
For the DRESS REHEARSAL! 
I think it was really good, and I'm excited for tomorrow night :) 
At this very moment, my dad, brother, and sister are on their way here for the weekend, and obviously I can't contain my excitement. 
However, I will be forced to compose myself long enough to take a shower, get my hair ready, and go to SLEEP, because I've got a BIG DAY TOMORROW!!!!

I'm feeling better about the opera. 
Still some obvious things that need to be worked out, but I honestly think that it will be ok...Hopefully. 
I guess I'm just so excited that my family (dad, brother, and sister) will be coming to see it!  
We're going to have a lot of fun...especially because we will be going to the $2 movie theater to see "Phantom of the Opera" which they have NEVER seen!! (It will be my 10th viewing...sickening, is it not?)
LoL 
Anyway, in other news: 
At church, I used to greet for the college group on Sunday mornings but now I am in the choir so I can't do that anymore.  
And I NEVER see the people that I used to greet with because I'm up in the choir loft and get no social time (that and the fact that over 6,000 people attend my church on a regular basis)...
But, Sunday night, we had a special occasion where there was a big get-together after the service.  
And it was a huge crowd eating cookies, drinking coffee, and listening to a rock band (yes, old people too lol)  
When, out of nowhere, I see one of the guys that I used to greet with!  
He's pretty cool, and people say he looks like Jesus (haha like anyone could even know that) 
But yeah, he's got the nice "Jesus Christ Superstar" hair look going on--it's pretty sweet. 
Anyway, we talked for a while and it was fun.  

Thank you for listening to the "random moment of my day" story.  
Stay tuned for the next "Tales from the Opera."

I'm getting a little bit nervous about the opera.  
There are a lot of people acting really ditzy and forgetful lately, which is not cool for being less than a week away from our first public performance.  
Oh well. 
At least people think I look hot in my costume ;)

Our drama department put on "The Miracle Worker" this semester.  
They did it two weekends in a row, and I saw it twice.  It was really good. 
My good friend Charity played Helen Keller, and she was amazing! 
She's a sophomore here, but she can totally pull off being 10 or 12 years old! 
Not to mention a blind and deaf 10 or 12 year old.  
The saddest part is that this was her first ever performance!! 
She's NEVER been in a play before, and she just auditioned at the last minute (she wasn't even going to) and got to play Helen Keller.  
I'm really happy for her, but it also makes me think of my own aspirations.  I love acting but it seems like anytime I audition or perform, I don't put everything I have into it because I'm all worried about what people will think.  
And that's STUPID.  
I need to just get in gear and not care if people think I'm a nerd or whatever.  
So, I guess that's what I learned over the past week...
Just thought I would share it with you.  
Also, I'm proud of myself because I've been doing a pretty good job of not eating junk food.  
I did have a dessert on my birthday because...well, come on.  
But other than that I haven't really been eating sweets that much (if at all). 
Plus, it's been a year and a half (maybe more) since I've had soda (or pop, whatever you call it).  
However...
Even though I've been disciplining myself in some areas, I'm definitely slacking in others.  
Such as HOMEWORK...and the state of my room...
Oh well.  
One thing at a time, right?

So...
I'm really busy.  
My room is a wreck, and my clothes are all over the floor.  
I have homework to do that was due a few weeks ago, plus the homework that I need to do before it's late (novel idea).  
Our opera is only like 2 weeks away, and there is still SO much to do for it.  
But other than that, things are going pretty well.  
My birthday was Sunday, and it was great.  
I only got a couple of things from people, but I was so excited that people actually thought of me, and wanted to spend time with me on my birthday!  :) 
I love having friends!! 
And I definitely ate too much, but hey...
it was mah burfday!! 
So, yeah...
And the best part is, after the opera (which my family is coming for, and I'm really excited about) there are only like one and a half weeks of school left and then I get to come HOME!!! 
These thoughts make me happy :) 
I hope everyone is doing well, and those of you in school, I hope you will not be stressed but finish strong and enjoy it!!

OK, I'm sorry it's taken me so long to update. 
I've had a really busy time.  
Anyway, I promised everyone I would fill them in about my Concert Choir tour...
So here it is (sorry to those who could care less): 
The tour was 10 days long and started in Michigan.  It was great because I got to stay in Detroit at my good friend Rebekah Walker's house with a big group of us.  I had been at her house last spring break so it was great to visit her family again.   
Then we headed to Ohio and Pennsylvania (where there was a gigantic blizzard but people still showed up).  In Pennsylvania I got to stay at the house of my friend that I work with here at Evangel.  She wasn't there but I got to meet her family and take crazy pictures and leave random notes in her bedroom HAHA 
And then we headed up the Northeast coast to Rhode Island and Massachusetts.  In Providence (Mona's hometown) I stayed with some of Emily Griswold's friends and we had a lot of fun!  Then we spent a day in Boston, where a few of us went to Cheers for lunch (good times).  In Haverhill, MA, my aunt Anna and my Grampa came to our concert and took me out to dinner!  It was SO good to see them (they only live an hour away from there, in Maine).  That night, Emily and I stayed at this awesome lady's house in New Hampshire.  She made us banana bread and chocolate chip cookies (and Yes, we definitely ate some cookie dough.)  We had a lot of fun with her photo shop program with the two high school girls that came over to spend the night.  From there, we headed back down for a few days in the Big Apple.  
That's right, we totally spent our free days in NYC.  It was great, because we had been working SO hard, we really needed a break.  
Some of my friends and I walked to Ground Zero from our hotel (then we got a limo because we were really tired of walking.  We split the price between all of us and we felt really cool).  Then we went to an awesome little Italian restaurant for dinner.  Our hotel has a diner on the main level, so I went there with some friends (for dessert lol) while a bunch of people went to Times Square (I was too tired.)  
I'm such a bum...I totally went to bed at like 11:00 pm the only night we were in Manhattan.  Isn't that sad? 
Anyway, the next morning, I slept in, and then I went to Chipotle for lunch, followed by a wonderful viewing of something called "The Phantom of the Opera."  :) It was really fun!! And a lot of people had never seen it (or any of New York for that matter) so they really enjoyed the whole experience!  After the show, we all stopped really quick to say hi to Mr. Morbitt (the guy that we know that plays Piangi in the cast!) but we had to hurry and get back because we had to get to...
HAGERSTOWN, MARYLAND!! 
I was so excited to go home and see my family, even though it was only for a few hours.  
We had a BLAST at my church and the concert and service went great! 
Thanks to those of you that came; it was so fun! (although it was really wierd seeing my two "lives" mixing, ya know?) 
After that the tour pretty much came to a close.  It was an AMAZING tour.  Some awesome times were had.  It was a great spiritual experience too.  The devotionals that we had everyday on the bus were really impacting, and all of our concerts meant something to us and our audiences.  We all became really close as a choir, and I'm sure I will never forget this trip :) 
Okay...
Sorry that was really long.  I have tons more I could say, but maybe I'll save that for next time! 
Thanks for putting up with this long entry!!

My midterms went pretty well! Thanks for all of the encouragement, guys.  I got my grades back and I have 8 A's and 2 B's...not bad.  
I got back from the Concert Choir spring tour last Tuesday night, but I haven't had the chance to update ever since.  
Sorry. 
Anyway, it was the most amazing tour! I loved it. 
And I fully intend on giving a ridiculously long entry about it in the near future, so stay tuned.  
But first, to all of those reading this who came to our concert at Bethel, thank you so much! 
We had a lot of fun, and I'm glad I got to share some of my college experience with some of my Maryland friends (and vice versa).  
And for those of you who didn't have a clue or couldn't make it, you'll hear about some of it in my next entry, but you won't be able to hear the music.
Whether that's unfortunate or fortunate, I can't say :) 
Anyway, just wanted to let you all know that I'm still alive and warn you of things to come...The Stories from the Concert Choir Big Rig.  
(Coming soon)

So many midterms, so little time. 
I have one on meteorology tomorrow and it will definitely be interesting, considering I haven't done much in the studying department.  
Although, I can definitely tell you about the lovely cumulus congestus clouds that were out today, and how they were formed. 
Yeah, buddy. 
Anyway, in Lifetime Fitness (worse class of my life, what do you think??)we usually exercise on Mondays and Wednesdays and have lectures on Fridays.  
Well, Monday I skipped because: 
a) I have a toe injury (don't ask) 
b) My voice teacher cancelled my lesson and if I skipped I wouldn't have to get up until 10:30 as opposed to 7:30. 
c) I HATE THE CLASS!!! 
So, that was fun...and when I asked someone what I missed, she told me that we're having lecture tomorrow and NO CLASS on Friday! 
Jesus loves me, this I know...
And, I can't WAIT until Saturday, because then I'll be leaving for Concert Choir tour! :) 
And just so you all know...I totally have a ticket to "The Phantom of the Opera" on Broadway for next Saturday afternoon!!! (Lucky!) 
So, yeah.  
Wish me luck on midterms. 
I really need to catch on to this whole studying concept.

The other night, I had a dream that I had an arranged marriage! 
It was wierd...I was in this counseling office or something, and this lady with a feathered 80's hairdo and really big glasses was sitting me down telling me she had something really important to tell me. 
Then, I'm sitting here on this couch as she tells me that, when I was a little girl, my mom and this guy's mom wrote up a contract on a napkin saying I had to marry him by such and such a day.  
Just when I thought the situation couldn't get any wierder (I know that's not a word), she asked me if I wanted to meet him. 
I said, "What, is he here right now??" 
And she said, "Yeah, he's right in the next room...Come on in!" 
And this other counselor lady comes in with a guy behind her, and he sits on the couch while they both tell us what's going on and what we're supposed to do. 
Yeah.
I don't know though.  Sometimes, I think that might just be easier.  Then I wouldn't have to worry about impressing people, or dating, or any of that stuff.  
Does that mean I wish that I had an arranged marriage? 
NOOOOOOOOOOOO.
I just thought it was an interesting thought.

It's over!! 
Yesterday we had the concert for the 50th Anniversary of Evangel University.  
It was an historic moment for a number of reasons, and the biggest shindig we've seen in a long time.  
We sang our guts out for months to get ready for it, and it all paid off! 
Everything went well, and we rocked...
And it's over. 
And I'm SO relieved. 
That's all. 
;)

Today I was cutting through the lawn on the way to a class. 
I saw someone I knew who was also cutting through the grass, and I waved to him.  
As he started to wave back, my foot caught in a little hole, and I fell flat on my face. 
Then, later, I saw a sheet of paper in my mailbox telling me to pick up a package at the post office!  
I was so excited, but in the next class I had the teacher decided to get really long winded and didn't let us go until 3:59.  
The post office closes at 4:00.  
Sad. 
I guess I'll just get it tomorrow.  
I think it's a really late Christmas package from my family in Maine! :) 
Well, tonight in our dorm we are having a "Prayer Walk."  
We're going around the hall and praying for each girl in front of her door.  
I think it's a good idea...Well, off I go to pray!! :)

I hope everyone had a good day yesterday.  
My voice teacher yelled at me for being poor, and told me that the concept of not having money was "beyond her."  
So, it didn't make me feel very good about myself.  
But oh well.
She'll regret it when I'm rich and famous.  
HA! 
Riiiiiight. 
Anyway, we have this HUGE Symphony Concert thing on Saturday evening where we will be performing 3 movements from a symphony written by one of our professors Dr. Akins, along with "Lobgesang" by Felix Mendelsohnn.  
They are both really REALLY hard and we are going to die! 
So, this afternoon we had a practice, tonight we have a practice, Thursday afternoon AND evening we have practice, Friday night we have practice, and Saturday morning we have practice. 
Then we perform Saturday night.  
Doesn't that sound really gross? 
I thought so too.  
Anyway, our practice starts in ten minutes so I had better go.  
Have a good night everyone!

Someday, I will appreciate Valentine's Day and not think of it as simply a time when those who have found someone that loves them can make it known to all, while those without someone sit in their rooms and cry.  
But not today. 
Today, I'm going to sit in my room and do homework while most of my friends are out on dates. 
It's ok, really. 
I like it this way...
And congratulations to all of you that have "someone"...or at least a date...or even a secret admirer! 
Don't take it for granted.  
And for those of you like me that are sort-of wallowing in self-pity right now...hold up.  
Because, we're still loved. 
I love you! 
(and I know someone else that loves you too...He told me so...)

I love friends. 
I love laughing.  
I love laughing with friends. 

The end.

If you read this, even if I don't speak to you often, you must post a memory of me. It can be anything you want, good or bad, just so long as it happened. Then post this to your journal. See what people remember about you.

So, last night, I definitely went to the theater and saw "Phantom" for the third time...it was awesome. 
And today, I have to do a lot of stuff...boring, not fun stuff.  
I should probably go do that now.  I hope everyone is having a great weekend. :)
